content.description: Stand start with match hands on the crimp rail above your head. Move your feet up, make two moves with your right hand on crimps, and do a high step with your left foot next to your left hand. Stand up, reach your left hand to the vertical crack, and use it as a sidepull. Move your right hand out the the arete, bump your left hand higher in the crack, then reach your right hand to the lip.
content.location:
It is not far upstream from "

The Junction

", slightly up the hill.

content.description: Stand start with your left hand on the higher crimp about head level and your right hand on a small sidepull. Do a hard move to the right, establish on two small polished crimps, set your feet, and dyno your right hand to the impossible sloper, while your left hand tries to go all the way to the lip.
content.location: It is on one of the bigger boulders down in the flats. Richie Hum also did a V4/5 arete on the same boulder - a few hard moves on a short arete.

content.description: Stand start with your right hand on a good arete hold and your left hand on bad, slopey crimp. Pull up, do a big move left hand move to a good edge, heel hook your right foot next to your right hand, then match your right hand with your left hand. Do a few tick tack hand moves up, then high step your left foot on the good edge your left hand was on. Reach up with your left hand to a gaston hold on the arete, stand up, continue up the arete on big holds, and then mantel the lip.
content.location: 3/4 of a mile past the last campsite, you will hit a flat area with boulders. This boulder is slightly up on the hill. It's the obvious tower.

content.description: Stand start using a left hand, slight sidepull crimp and your right hand on a crimp. Move up to smaller crimps on zero feet, and make a huge move to the lip?
content.location:
This is a potential project to the left of "

Richie's Arete

."

content.description: Stand start matched on the big sidepull jug, then do a big left hand move up to sloping dish. Do a right heel hook next to your right hand, then your right hand goes to a slopey crimp next to your left hand. Adjust your feet, make a big left hand move to a blind sloper, match your hands, then pull the lip.
content.location: It is on a water polished cliff next to the river. Possible lines might exist to the left, but they will be hard.
